column4: I am loving the show! Can't wait for next season.

text: After you solve problems for top customers
column4: focus on next batch. This is growth strategy. Keep identifying problems to solve @trueventures

text: Build problem solving into culture early in the company's life. Focus on high value customer needs. #designthinking
When you solve problems
column4: you can lead in a market. Drive the company strategy with problem solving. Bundle features into solutions. #design

text: Replace product roadmap with problems you want to solve
column4: not features you want to add. Think: problem solving. #uxdesign @trueventures

text: Innovation is adding value
column4: not adding new inventions

text: Soon delights become basic expectations. Must design products to accommodate them without cramming in too many features. Take baby steps.
Products that have a compelling story sell. The story ensures customers understnd the quality
column4: the value prop

text: Raise the entire customer journey up to be pure delight. Pleasure. Flow. Meaning. @danachis #uxdesign
Apple maps had great features but bad data. It failed. Basic expectation is that map is accurate. @jmspool @trueventures #uxdesign
When companies are too bloated a startup will steal market share by focusing on one feature and doing it better. So make features work hard.
Features can be booted from product. In fact they should be. Otherwise you get experience rot. A product that is overly complicated sucks.
When companies focus on #UX they realize there are handful of key features that matter. Rebuild the product with these alone: new codebase.
But don't make #UX too complex or it degrades the product. Too many options pollute the overall experience-things will break. @trueventures
Basic expectations are set by outside forces
column4: says Kano. Excitement generators (new features) are put in later in V2. #ux @trueventures

text: .@jmspool says remove sucky parts and add delightful bits to move our users to become fans. @trueventures workshop. https://t.co/ScH1FB5cOx
